DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Ginseng Extract on Improvement of Bone Metabolism in Menopausal Women
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators performed a 12-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled human trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ginseng extract on improvement of Bone metabolism in menopausal women. The investigators measured Serum Osteocalcin, Urinary Deoxypyridinoline, DPD/OC ratio, Serum CTX, NTX, Ca, Phosphorus, BSALP(vone specific-alkaline phosphatase), P1NP(Procollagen type 1 N-terminal propeptide), WOMAC index(Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis).
DOC.criteria: age older than 40 years, after a amenorrhea 6 months in women Tscore less than 1.0, osteocalcin 8(ng/mL) or more and DPD 5.2(nMDPD/mMcreatinine) or more, subjects giving written informed consent Diagnosed osteoporosis BMI ≤ 18.5kg/m2 or BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2 Cardiovascular disease, e.g. arrhythmia, heart failure, myocardial infarction, and patient with pacemaker History of disease that could interfere with the test products or impede their absorption, such as gastrointestinal disease or gastrointestinal surgery Participation in any other clinical trials within past 2 months Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to interfere with successful participation in the study Pregnancy or breast feeding etc,.
